Understate: The claim may understate the amount of one-time money used to balance the budget, as other analysts have provided higher estimates.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific details or evidence to back up the assertion that $4.89 billion in one-time money was used.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the use of one-time money in the current budget will lead to a structural imbalance in future budgets, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or reasons for the use of one-time money in the budget, such as economic conditions or specific funding needs.
